intro: Sarcomphalus havanensis var. havanensis, commonly known as the Cuban star-of-Bahamas, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
